20.notes:
Ubuntu 20 does not have a system supplied package for eCAL, but it can be installed from the vendor by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ecal/ecal-latest -y -u
sudo apt-get update

22.notes:
Ubuntu 22 does not have a system supplied package for eCAL, but it can be installed from the vendor by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ecal/ecal-latest -y -u
sudo apt-get update

37.pkg: graphviz hdf5-devel libcurl-devel qwt-qt5-devel qt5-qtbase-devel libyaml-devel zlib-devel openssl-devel

37.notes: Fedora does not supply libuvc from its repositories. You will need to install it from https://github.com/libuvc/libuvc.

38.notes: Fedora does not supply libuvc from its repositories. You will need to install it from https://github.com/libuvc/libuvc.

9.notes: CentOS does not supply libuvc from its repositories. You will need to install it from https://github.com/libuvc/libuvc.
No OpenNI package is natively available for CentOS

Centos does not provide a complete version of OpenCV in their repos, in particular the 'viz' component is missing. You will need to install the VTK-devel package and the ILLIXR build system will compile OpenCV from source.

You may also need to run the following:

sudo dnf -y install dnf-plugins-core epel-release
sudo dnf config-manager --set-enabled crb

20.notes:
Ubuntu 20 does not have a system supplied package for OpenXR, but it can be installed from the vendor by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo apt-get -y install wget software-properties-common
sudo apt-get update
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:monado-xr/monado -y -u
sudo wget -nv https://monado.freedesktop.org/keys/monado-ci.asc -O /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/monado-ci.asc
sudo echo 'deb https://monado.pages.freedesktop.org/monado/apt focal main' | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/monado-ci.list
sudo apt update

20.pkg: qemu qemu-system qemu-system-data qeum-utils qemu-user libqcow-dev libqcow-utils

22.pkg: qemu qemu-system qemu-system-data qeum-utils qemu-user libqcow-dev libqcow-utils

20.notes:
Ubuntu does not have a system supplied package for librealsense, but it can be installed from the vendor (Intel) by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo apt-get -y install curl apt-transport-https lsb-core
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
sudo curl -sSf https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/librealsense.pgp | tee /etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp > /dev/null
sudo echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp] https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/apt-repo `lsb_release -cs` main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/librealsense.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update

22.notes:
Ubuntu does not have a system supplied package for librealsense, but it can be installed from the vendor (Intel) by adding the following repo to your system:
sudo apt-get -y install curl apt-transport-https lsb-core
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings
sudo curl -sSf https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/librealsense.pgp | tee /etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp > /dev/null
sudo echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/librealsense.pgp] https://librealsense.intel.com/Debian/apt-repo `lsb_release -cs` main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/librealsense.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update

9.postnotes:
Centos does not provide a vendor version of librealsense, but it can be automatically compiled and installed with the following, possibly as sudo (run after installing the above packages):
git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vcpkg.git
cd vcpkg
./bootstrap-vcpkg.sh
./vcpkg integrate install
./vcpkg install realsense2

20.notes: ZED SDK is required for the zed plugin. It must be installed manually. See here for details. It also requires some CUDA packages which should be available here or through your Ubuntu repo.

22.notes: ZED SDK (version 3) is required for the zed plugin. It must be installed manually. See here for details. It also requires some CUDA packages which should be available here or through your Ubuntu repo.
